main event: A radar operator spotted a bright, round, white object heading towards a B-47 aircraft at Charleston Air Force Base in 1949.
interesting points: The object suddenly changed direction and climbed rapidly away from the aircraft, disappearing in a matter of seconds.
The object appeared to have no visible means of propulsion.
The radar operator stated that the visual and radar reports were very similar to those received when the object being tracked was a malfunction of the radar itself.
A U.S. Air Force Technical Information Sheet was used to gather details about the unidentified aerial phenomenon.
The object was observed in clear weather conditions with moderate winds.
